meanings.definition: A nervous disorder characterized by involuntary movements of the limbs and facial muscles.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with chorea after observing her uncontrollable arm movements.
meanings.sent2: The chorea caused her legs to twitch unexpectedly during the dance performance.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, the chorea made her look like she was dancing to an invisible tune.
meanings.sent4: Her limbs moved with the erratic rhythm of a wild chorea, as if controlled by unseen strings.
meanings.sent5: The chorea turned her body into a puppet, pulling her limbs in unpredictable directions.

meanings.definition: A rapid, jerky, involuntary movement of the body or limbs.
meanings.sent1: His chorea made it challenging for him to sit still in class.
meanings.sent2: The sudden chorea in her arm startled the people around her.
meanings.sent3: The chorea in his legs seemed to have a mind of its own, causing him to stumble comically.
meanings.sent4: The chorea in her fingers resembled a flurry of butterflies taking flight.
meanings.sent5: The chorea turned his body into a living, unpredictable dance, much to his embarrassment.
